doc.title: Country Garden Services (6098.HK)
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS/Country Garden Services 6098.HK Stabilizing core business scale supports better FCF generation up to NeutralCountry Gard_2025-08-28

passages.text: We upgrade Country Garden Services (CGS) from Sell to Neutral as we see stable recurring business scale with improving cash flow outlook after multi- year painstaking business restructuring, including exits from lower- performing contracts and re- focusing on core business by downsizing non- core ones. On the other hand, we remain cautious on the company's core business margins (currently c.5pp above industry normalized level), which might not be sustainable given its portfolio mix change towards more lower- end segment and macro uncertainties. The company reported 1H25 core profit at Rmb1.6bn, down \(15\%\) yoy (a narrower contraction pace vs. \(- 23\%\) in FY24) and equivalent to \(53\%\) of prior full- year GSe (broadly inline), with upbeat core business topline \((+15\%)\) yoy, ahead of most PM peers despite CGS' already substantial scale) yet another 3pp yoy GPM deterioration. Though 1H cash profile witnessed some hiccups (OCF outflow enlarged by Rmb0.6bn and AR balance gross \(8\%\) yoy) due to seasonality, one- off advanced payment, etc., blended collection rate notably improved 4pp yoy to \(90\%\) alongside tech- empowered collection mechanisms. Management kept constructive 25E guidance intact - a HSD% yoy topline expansion pace, bottoming- out core profit trend, coupled with an above 1X OCF/NI ratio on the back of \(100\%\) full- year blended collection rate. Since we added the stock to our Sell list on 1/13/2025, CGS' share price increased \(28\%\) vs. coverage average \(+20\%\) and MSCI China \(+36\%\) , due to increasing dividend hike possibility after announced loan to controlling shareholder.

We revise 2025E- 27E core net profit by an average of \(+4\%\) to reflect: 1) average \(3\%\) higher revenue forecast at a \(3\%\) CAGR in 2025E- 27E, mainly on more optimistic revenue- bearing GFA forecasts, higher 2C VAS revenue as well as higher TSPM revenues; 2) average 0.8pp lower GPM while 0.4pp lower SG&A expenses against revenue ratio in 2025E- 27E. We also revise up our OCF and FCF estimates for 26E- 27E.

Raise TP to HK\$6.3 (from HK\$5.1), based on an 8X 2027E FCF discounted back to 2025E with a \(13.7\%\) CoE (vs. prior 7X with a \(15.3\%\) CoE after adjusting Beta from prior 1.66 (yr avg) to 1.42 (average during 2024- 1H25)). CGS trades at 7X/7X/6X 2025E- 27E core P/E against \(7\%\) core profit CAGR plus \(10\%\) dividend yield, vs. our PM coverage of 11X/10X/9X against \(9\%\) and \(5\%\) . We view the company's risk- reward

Analysts employed by non- US affiliates are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA in the U.S.
profile as more balanced and upgrade to Neutral.

We turn more constructive towards CGS' core business topline and cash profit visibility: two key positive surprises in 1H25 were: 1) core business topline growth at \(+15\%\) yoy, including respectively \(+7\% / + 5\% / + 52\%\) for property management services (PMS), community value- added- services (2C VAS) and Three Supplies & Property Management (TSPM) segments. We note strengthening external project sourcing by the company, with its newly obtained 3P GFA surging \(66\%\) yoy in 1H25, as CGS engages low- end residential projects inside its \(300+\) city footprint via its value- for- money and differentiated service packages as well as explores opportunities from old community renovation, sending the company's management scale up \(3\%\) from end- 24 level to 1.06bn sqm (vs. most POE PM peers registering declining/flattish GFA during 1H25). Management also commented that multiple niche specialized 2C services that CGS restructured/incubated over the past years could be entering fast- growing phases (e.g. spirits sales, vehicle energy- charging business, etc.) and the company is aiming for 5 of such 2C VAS sub- segments to reach Rmb1bn revenue scale by 28E; and 2) strengthened collection rate: blended collection rate increased 4pp yoy to \(90\%\) (vs. many peers reported yoy deteriorated collection performance in 1H25 amid macro adversity), on the back of various tech- empowered collection mechanisms. Management is confident to achieve \(100\%\) collection for the full- year 25E (up c.5pp yoy). This, coupled with the company's active exits from low- cash- performance projects and contracts over the past years, could underpin a Rmb3bn level core cash profit outlook by 27E, in our view.

Consistent efforts to bolster shareholders return, including: 1) raising dividend payout ratio (against core profit) to \(60\%\) , well above both prior management guided min. level of Rmb0.99bn (or \(33\%\) against prior FY25 GSe core profit) as well as our estimated \(45\%\) , which would suggest up- sized dividend yield potentially to \(10\%\) (top among our PM coverage); and 2) committed share repurchases, whereby management vowed to fully spend Rmb500mn from Mar- 24 to Mar- 25 (incl. c.Rmb55mn already spent so far). We expect such efforts to be well- supported by cash profit generation of the company's core business (aforementioned) and ample cash reserves (as of 1H25, CGS' gross cash balance expanded \(22\%\) to Rmb15bn).

GPM, however, could still be in downward trajectory: 1H25 GPM came in below expectation with PMS/2C VAS/TSPM GPM respectively down 1/9/1pp yoy. In contrast to most of its PM peers who have been turning more focused on core cities and high- end projects, we are concerned that CGS' strategy to embrace low- fee level projects (as low as Rmb1.5/sqm/mth, vs. its current average of Rmb2.0) could result in further margin decline.

Key risks: (+/-) above- expectation scale growth due to effective project sourcing and business cooperation, or scale expansion miss due to intensified third party market competition and external project engagement missteps; (+/-) more- resilient- than- expected GPM supported by effective cost- saving initiatives (e.g. automation, AI, etc.) and economies of scale, or unexpected GPM deterioration due to increasing portfolio exposure to low- fee level lower- margin existing housing projects, downward pressure on PM fee due to policy regulations and lower consumer
confidence, etc.; (+) stronger-than- expected recurring VAS execution/development, esp. niche, specialized services.

\\* Core net profit excludes expenses of share options, unrealized gains or losses from financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, amortization charges of intangible assets (contracts and customer relationships, insurance brokerage licenses and brands arising from M&A, etc.), impairment of loans to third parties pledged by equities, losses from disposal of subsidiaries, expected losses on external guarantee, impairment of receivables from related parties and fair value gains of contingent consideration related to performance guarantees.
Source: Company data, Bloomberg, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research

We are Neutral- rated on CGS. We see stable recurring business scale with improving cash flow outlook after multi- year painstaking business restructuring, including exits from lower- performing contracts and re- focusing on core business by downsizing non- core ones. On the other hand, we remain cautious on the company's core business margins (currently c.5pp above industry normalized level), which might not be sustainable given its portfolio mix change towards more lower- end segment and macro uncertainties.

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.

Not Rated (NR). The investment rating, target price and earnings estimates (where relevant) are removed pursuant to Goldman Sachs policy when Goldman Sachs is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or in a strategic transaction involving this company, when there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints due to Goldman Sachs' involvement in a transaction, and in certain other circumstances. Early- Stage Biotech (ES). An investment rating and a target price are not assigned pursuant to Goldman Sachs policy when this company neither has a drug, treatment or medical device that has passed a Phase II clinical trial nor a license to distribute a post- Phase II drug, treatment or medical device. Rating Suspended (RS). No change to an analyst's fundamental research views (e.g., ratings, price targets, or material changes to earnings estimates for equity securities), will be communicated to any client prior to inclusion of such information in a research report broadly disseminated through electronic publication to our internal client websites or through other means, as necessary, to all clients who are entitled to receive such reports.

All research reports are disseminated and available to all clients simultaneously through electronic publication to our internal client websites. Not all research content is redistributed to our clients or available to third- party aggregators, nor is Goldman Sachs responsible for the redistribution of our research by third party aggregators. For research, models or other data related to one or more securities, markets or asset classes (including related services) that may be available to you, please contact your GS representative or go to https://research.gs.com.
Disclosure information is also available at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html or from Research Compliance, 200 West Street, New York, NY 10282.

You are permitted to store, display, analyze, modify, reformat, and print the information made available to you via this service only for your own use. You may not resell or reverse engineer this information to calculate or develop any index for disclosure and/or marketing or create any other derivative works or commercial product(s), data or offering(s) without the express written consent of Goldman Sachs. You are not permitted to publish, transmit, or otherwise reproduce this information, in whole or in part, in any format to any third party without the express written consent of Goldman Sachs. This foregoing restriction includes, without limitation, using, extracting, downloading or retrieving this information, in whole or in part, to train or finetune a machine learning or artificial intelligence system, or to provide or reproduce this information, in whole or in part, as a prompt or input to any such system.
